intro: Lycoris anhuiensis, commonly known as the Anhui lily, is a rare species native to China. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in the autumn. The plant features narrow, strap-like leaves that emerge from a bulbous base. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
